document_notes.text:
This update for emacs fixes the following issues:

  - CVE-2022-48337: Fixed etags local command injection vulnerability (bsc#1208515).
  - CVE-2022-48339: Fixed htmlfontify.el command injection vulnerability (bsc#1208512).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text: GNU Emacs through 28.2 allows attackers to execute commands via shell metacharacters in the name of a source-code file, because lib-src/etags.c uses the system C library function in its implementation of the etags program. For example, a victim may use the "etags -u *" command (suggested in the etags documentation) in a situation where the current working directory has contents that depend on untrusted input.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".

notes.text: An issue was discovered in GNU Emacs through 28.2. htmlfontify.el has a command injection vulnerability. In the hfy-istext-command function, the parameter file and parameter srcdir come from external input, and parameters are not escaped. If a file name or directory name contains shell metacharacters, code may be executed.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description
